thread.title: Wilson returns; Lions nearly back to full strength at practice
thread.title_full: Wilson returns; Lions nearly back to full strength at practice

author: detroitnews.com
title: Wilson returns; Lions nearly back to full strength at practice
text:
Cornerback Josh Wilson return to practice Friday after missing time due to a concussion. (Photo: Daniel Mears, Detroit News) 
CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Allen Park — Cornerback Josh Wilson returned to Lions practice Friday after missing the previous two days due to a concussion.
Although he declined again to provide details on Wilson’s brain injury, coach Jim Caldwell said the Lions are still following the league’s return-to-play protocol for the harmful ailment.
With Wilson back, the Lions were nearly at full strength on the practice field. Tight end Brandon Pettigrew (knee/elbow) and linebacker DeAndre Levy (hip) were out, so neither will play in Sunday’s game against the Vikings (1 p.m., FOX).
Caldwell also declined to say whether running back Joique Bell (ankle) suffered a setback this week. Bell was a full participant Wednesday before being limited Thursday. Although he was on the field for the portion open to the media Friday, his status for Sunday is unclear after he missed the last three games.
Strong safety James Ihedigbo (quad) practice for the second day in a row, though he was limited Thursday.
The team will provide game designations for its injured players later Friday afternoon.
jkatzenstein@detroitnews.com
